title: 'Humanitarian consequences': India reacts to US H-1B visa fee hike; maps way forward
content: The Indian government has voiced concerns over the US decision to increase H-1B visa fees to $100,000 annually, foreseeing potential disruptions for Indian professionals and their families. This move, effective September 21, 2025, is defended by US officials as a measure to curb program abuse and generate revenue, but it raises worries about its impact on talent mobility and the competitiveness of the US technology sector.

title: In numbers: H-1B was already tough for Indians; Trump's $100K fee just made it tougher
content: The H-1B programme was created in 1990 with a cap of 65,000 visas per year, later expanded to include 20,000 extra slots for US master‚Äôs degree holders. That total of 85,000 visas has not changed in over a decade, even as America‚Äôs economy and demand for skilled workers exploded.

title: 'Open & non-discriminatory': China on TikTok deal with US
content: China has affirmed its stance on the TikTok issue in the US, emphasizing respect for enterprise autonomy and welcoming market-based negotiations that comply with Chinese laws. They urge the US to provide a fair business environment for Chinese companies like TikTok. Despite Trump's touted "deal," experts note finalization is distant.

title: H-1B visa hike: JPMorgan asks staff to return to US before Sept 21
content: JPMorgan has advised H1-B visa holders abroad to return to the US before September 21. This follows President Trump's order of a $100,000 annual fee for each H-1B worker. Microsoft has issued a similar advisory. The new rule is expected to impact Indian IT firms like Infosys and TCS.

title: H-1B fee hike: Trump‚Äôs $100,000 rule sparks outcry; attorneys prepare legal action
content: Donald Trump's new rule impacts H-1B visa holders. A $100,000 fee is needed for entry after September 21, 2025. This affects many Indians awaiting US jobs. Legal challenges are expected. The policy raises concerns about fairness. Experts predict uncertainty for businesses and professionals. The proclamation's legality is under scrutiny. It may face court injunctions soon.

title: ‚ÄòWhen one door closes ‚Ä¶‚Äô: Radhika Gupta on Trump‚Äôs $100K H-1B fee
content: The Trump administration's significant H-1B visa fee hike, now at $100,000 per application, has sent ripples through the tech industry. Radhika Gupta, Edelweiss Mutual Fund CEO, encourages young professionals to view this as an opportunity to return to India. She highlights India's growth and potential, suggesting it offers fulfilling careers and the chance to contribute to the nation's development.

title: Asia Cup: Drama in Dubai! Pak cancel press conference beofre India match
content: Pakistan have cancelled its pre-match press conference before their Asia Cup Super Four clash against India, marking the second consecutive time they've skipped media duties. This follows a dispute with match referee Andy Pycroft over a handshake controversy during their previous encounter. The PCB's request to remove Pycroft was rejected, leading to heightened tensions and potential ICC action against Pakistan.

title: ‚ÄòGukesh is not even 20 yet‚Äô: Grand Swiss was an eye-opener in many ways
content: The FIDE Grand Swiss 2025 witnessed Anish Giri's triumph and Vaishali Rameshbabu's repeat victory, alongside Matthias Bluebaum's unexpected Candidates qualification. Despite Gukesh Dommaraju's stumble, the event highlighted India's mixed fortunes and the rise of young talents like America's Abhimanyu Mishra. Divya Deshmukh's fearless performance in the Open section also underscored the growing strength of women in chess, inspiring future participation.

title: H-1B visa fees hike to $100K: Microsoft warns employees; asks to return immediately
content: Microsoft urged its H-1B and H-4 visa employees to return to the US before the September 21 deadline due to a new $100,000 annual fee per H-1B worker. The company also advised those already in the US to remain there.

title: Barc making reactor for Navy‚Äôs next-gen N-subs
content: Bhabha Atomic Research Centre is developing a powerful 200 MWe reactor to significantly enhance the endurance of the Indian Navy's future submarines, including the S-5 class. This upgrade, more than doubling the power of existing reactors, is crucial for strengthening India's sea-based nuclear deterrent amidst China's growing naval capabilities.

title: Why does SKY close his eyes during nat'l anthem? India captain explains
content: Suryakumar Yadav revealed he closes his eyes during the Indian national anthem to reflect on the immense pride and gratitude he feels representing his country. He cherishes every opportunity to wear the Indian jersey and thanks God for the chance to play. The India-Pakistan match held special significance, marking his first encounter against Pakistan as captain.

title: NFL‚Äôs richest: Top 10 stars ranked; Mahomes leads, Kelce-Swift pays off
content: Patrick Mahomes tops the 2025 NFL earners with $80 million, combining his Chiefs salary and endorsements from brands and sports team investments. Quarterbacks dominate the top spots, including Josh Allen, Justin Herbert, Dak Prescott, and Tua Tagovailoa. Travis Kelce leads in endorsements, boosted by his podcast and celebrity connection, while Micah Parsons, T.J.

title: 'I repeat‚Ä¶‚Äô: Rahul‚Äôs ‚Äòweak PM‚Äô jibe at Modi after Trump‚Äôs H-1B fee hike; shares old post
content: Following the US decision to impose a hefty $100,000 fee on H-1B visa applications, Congress launched a coordinated attack on Prime Minister Narendra Modi. Rahul Gandhi criticized Modi as a "weak PM" for failing to protect Indian interests, while Mallikarjun Kharge referenced Trump's past claims and PM Modi's rally with him.

title: ‚ÄòMaareech‚Äô: UP CM says Disha Patani's shooter came from outside UP; likens him to Ramayan demon
content: Yogi Adityanath likened an arrested shooter in the Disha Patani firing case to 'Maareech' from Ramayan. The shooter, Ramanivas, was apprehended after an encounter with UP police. He confessed to the crime and allegedly vowed never to return to Uttar Pradesh. The incident involved firing at Disha Patani's family home in Bareilly. Ramanivas sustained a bullet injury during the arrest.

title: Mystery in skies: Fiery streaks dazzle Delhi-NCR residents, spark buzz; watch video
content: Early Saturday, Delhi and NCR residents witnessed a dazzling display of fiery streaks across the sky, sparking widespread curiosity. The brief but intense flash, brighter than city lights, prompted speculation about meteors or space debris. Experts suggest it was likely a bolide, a meteor that fragments upon atmospheric entry.

title: Inoue vs Nakatani: Japan loses boxing night; Saudi Arabia grabs spotlight
content: Japanese boxing fans will miss a historic Tokyo Dome event as Ring V: Night of the Samurai moves to Riyadh‚Äôs Mohammed Abdo Arena on December 27. Headlined by Naoya Inoue and co-featured by Junto Nakatani, the shift frustrates local fans, though fighters earn record paydays, marking Saudi Arabia‚Äôs growing presence in global boxing.

title: H-1B visa fee hike: A self-goal for US? Why it's good for India
content: Donald Trump's decision to impose a $100,000 annual fee on H-1B visas has sparked debate, with Indian leaders warning of potential benefits for India. Experts suggest this move could discourage applications, accelerate offshoring, and prompt skilled professionals to return to India. While facing backlash in the US, the long-term impact may fuel India's growth as a global innovation hub.

title: 4 killed in Russia‚Äôs Samara region in Ukrainian drone strike
content: A Ukrainian drone strike in Russia's Samara region resulted in the deaths of four people and injured one, according to the local Governor. This attack followed a large-scale Russian missile and drone assault on Ukraine, which killed at least three and injured dozens across nine regions.

title: 'Don‚Äôt know what you‚Äôre talking about,‚Äô says Suryakumar over Ind-Pak matches
content: Suryakumar Yadav prioritises entertaining fans over the India-Pakistan rivalry, emphasising quality cricket. He acknowledged managing external pressures by focusing on team unity and selective attention to outside noise. Yadav's previous no-handshake gesture, a tribute to the armed forces, caused tension, but he redirected focus to the team's strong performance and preparation for the upcoming Asia Cup clash.

title: Delhi: Over 100 schools receive bomb threats; turns out to be hoax
content: Over 100 schools in Delhi received bomb threats via email on Saturday morning, causing widespread panic and prompting immediate evacuations. The email, sent by a group identifying as 'Terrorizers111,' triggered extensive searches by bomb disposal squads and police teams.

title: Hailee Steinfeld: Josh Allen‚Äôs wife teases new career; actress to entrepreneur
content: Hailee Steinfeld, celebrated for her acting career and recent success with 'Sinners,' has hinted at a potential future behind the camera, expressing interest in capturing authentic moments. Meanwhile, her husband, Buffalo Bills' quarterback Josh Allen, is leading his team through a winning streak, overcoming a recent injury to secure victories. Steinfeld has been seen supporting Allen throughout the season.

title: 'Let Asia Cup go to hell': Ex-PCB chief; reveals Pak's pullout threat
content: Former PCB chief Najam Sethi disclosed that Pakistan nearly boycotted their Asia Cup match against UAE due to tensions sparked by Indian players' refusal to shake hands. The PCB demanded the removal of match referee Andy Pycroft, threatening to withdraw from the tournament. The PCB chairmen convened on September 17 to discuss the possibility of pulling out.

title: What causes constipation? 5 underlying reasons explained; simple ways to tackle them
content: Constipation is associated with a sense of discomfort and its symptoms generally include: Less than three bowel movements a week, passing hard or lumpy stools, feeling of blockage in the rectum. In most cases, is caused by lifestyle factors and eating habits and can be relieved without the help of medication. Severe or persistent constipation can signal underlying medical conditions, in such cases it is advised that individuals seek medical advice.

title: Cyberattack at European airports; flights delayed, cancelled - all you need to know
content: A cyberattack on a third-party service provider has caused significant disruptions at major European airports, including Heathrow, Brussels, and Berlin. Automated check-in and boarding systems were rendered inoperable, forcing airlines to switch to manual processing, leading to widespread flight delays and cancellations. Airports are working to resolve the issue, while Frankfurt Airport confirmed it was unaffected.

title: Handshake row: ICC appoints match officials for India vs Pakistan; who will referee?
content: Despite recent controversies and objections from the Pakistan Cricket Board regarding Andy Pycroft's conduct, the ICC has appointed him as the match referee for the crucial Asia Cup 2025 Super 4s match between India and Pakistan. This decision follows PCB's allegations and a subsequent threat to withdraw from the tournament, which was later resolved through negotiations.

title: Himachal monsoon havoc: Death toll rises to 427; 243 rain-related deaths, 184 in accidents
content: The monsoon havoc in Himachal Pradesh continues unabated, with the death toll climbing to 427 between June 20 and September 20, according to the State Disaster Management Authority (SDMA).

title: 'Thousands evacuated': WWII-era US bomb found in Hong Kong
content: A massive World War II-era US bomb was unearthed at a construction site in Hong Kong's Quarry Bay, leading to the overnight evacuation of approximately 6,000 residents. Bomb disposal experts successfully defused the 1.5-meter long device after a delicate operation lasting until Saturday morning.

title: 'Bring Grandma Home': Hundreds rally in California against Harjit Kaur's arrest
content: The detention of 73-year-old Harjit Kaur, an Indian grandmother, by ICE has sparked outrage in California. Kaur, a long-time Bay Area resident, was detained during a routine check-in, despite living legally in the US for three decades and regularly reporting to ICE. Supporters, including lawmakers, are demanding her release, citing her health concerns and community contributions.

title: Navratri colours: Know the colour for each day of the Shardiya Navratri
content: This year, let's celebrate the Shardiya Navratri with beautiful colours representing each form of Maa Durga, making every day more alluring.

title: UP horror: Man stabs pregnant wife to death over Rs 100; mother injured
content: In Lucknow, Ankur murdered his pregnant wife, Neelam, after she refused to give him Rs 100 for alcohol. He attacked her with a stick and then stabbed her multiple times. His mother, Phoolkumari, was seriously injured when she tried to intervene, while Ankur has been arrested and is now in jail.

title: 'Great Sunday': Suryakumar Yadav promises win to Indians; skips naming opponents
content: Ahead of India‚Äôs blockbuster clash with Pakistan in the Asia Cup, captain Suryakumar Yadav avoided naming the opponent but promised 1.4 billion Indians a ‚Äúfantastic Sunday.‚Äù High on nationalistic fervour, Surya urged his team to shut out outside noise, focus on their preparations, and play with intensity.

title: ‚ÄòCreated by nature‚Äô: DKS blames vehicles, traffic, rain for pothole-riddled roads; slams BJP
content: Karnataka's Deputy CM, DK Shivakumar, attributes Bengaluru's pothole problem to natural causes like heavy rain and traffic, countering criticism of negligence. Despite repairing over 7,000 potholes, thousands remain, prompting a police report and citizen involvement. Shivakumar also refuted claims of IT companies leaving due to poor infrastructure, asserting the government won't be threatened.

title: Vadodara: Stones pelted at ‚Äòvajra‚Äô police vehicle over social post; probe under way
content: Tension flared in Godhra as mobs pelted stones at police after a man was brought in for questioning regarding a religious poster video circulating online. Police used force to disperse the crowd, intensifying patrols. Authorities clarified the man was cautioned against disruptive content ahead of Navratri, denying allegations of assault.

title: Defence pact: Pak minister asked if Saudi will step in if war with India ‚Äì What Khawaja Asif said
content: Pakistan's defence minister claims Saudi Arabia will support Pakistan in case of war with India, citing their new defence pact ensuring mutual assistance if either nation is attacked. India has responded cautiously, stating it will study the implications of the agreement on its national security and regional stability, while acknowledging the formalization of a long-standing arrangement.

title: Russia‚Äôs 'massive' attack on Ukraine: 40 missiles, 580 drones fired overnight; 3 killed
content: Russia launched a massive overnight attack on Ukraine, firing 40 missiles and approximately 580 drones, resulting in at least three deaths and dozens of injuries. The hardest-hit areas included Dnipro, Chernigiv, and Khmelnytskyi. Meanwhile, Russia claimed to have repelled Ukrainian drone attacks and intercepted 149 drones, as fighting intensifies in eastern Ukraine.

title: The sneaky Big Ten game, the hyped-but-struggling QBs and more in Week 4
content: Saturday's action features an unusual Big Ten showdown, a fun Big 12 headliner and a bunch of QBs looking to get right.

title: Poll: Sellers edges Nussmeier as NFL draft's QB1
content: South Carolina's LaNorris Sellers is the top vote-getter among 25 NFL scouts and executives polled by ESPN to see who they project as the top quarterback for the upcoming draft.

title: Hall joins Joyner-Kersee as U.S. heptathlon champ
content: Anna Hall became America's second winner of the world heptathlon title -- joining Jackie Joyner-Kersee -- by wrapping up a wire-to-wire endurance test and cruising into the finish line Saturday to celebrate her biggest victory.

title: Kershaw soaks in curtain call in possible L.A. finale
content: Clayton Kershaw treated Dodgers fans to a strikeout on his final pitch Friday night and left the field to raucous cheers in his last regular-season start at Dodger Stadium.

title: Tulsa tops OSU in Stillwater for 1st time since '51
content: Baylor Hayes threw for 219 yards and a touchdown to help Tulsa defeat Oklahoma State in Stillwater on Friday night for the first time since Nov. 3, 1951.

title: Italian rapper apologizes for Sinner-Hitler lyric
content: Italian rapper Fedez has apologized for publishing lyrics saying that tennis star Jannik Sinner speaks with "Adolf Hitler's accent," which prompted the musician to be accused of inciting racial hatred.

title: Sources: Fiziev injured, out of bout vs. Oliveira
content: UFC lightweight Rafael Fiziev has withdrawn from his Oct. 11 bout against Charles Oliveira after suffering an injury in training, sources confirmed to ESPN.

title: 49ers to start Jones at QB in place of ailing Purdy
content: Barring a significant last-minute change, the San Francisco 49ers will start Mac Jones at quarterback for a second consecutive week Sunday against the Arizona Cardinals.

title: Ravens' Henry: Keep calling Hopkins 'washed'
content: Ravens RB Derrick Henry has heard the naysayers, and he's daring opponents to continue calling veteran receiver DeAndre Hopkins "washed."

content: Andrew Luck made his return to football in late 2024 in a surprising role, as Stanford football GM. As Luck returned, so did an old social media legend: Capt. Andrew Luck.

content: Max Verstappen denied Carlos Sainz and Williams a shock pole position in one of the great Formula 1 qualifying sessions, featuring six red flags.

content: There are two words MLB and the MLBPA simply cannot agree on. Here's how it got this way and what it means for the next CBA.

content: The Eagles have converted the tush push 96.6% of the time on fourth-and-1, so why don't all teams use it? Here's why.

title: ‚öæ Dodgers' Clayton Kershaw to retire after season
content: Clayton Kershaw, a three-time National League Cy Young Award winner and 11-time All-Star with the Dodgers, will retire after this season. "I'm at peace with it," he said. "I think it's the right time."

title: üé§ Johnson: Not giving 'trade secrets' to Brady
content: Ben Johnson isn't worried about divulging information that can be used against the Bears when he participates in production meetings with Tom Brady.

content: Nottingham Forest's Elliot Anderson has emerged as a January target for Manchester United. Transfer Talk has the latest news and rumors.

content: These fantasy hockey players underwhelmed last season, but could return to better production this year.

title: Gurugram Doctor Arrested For Running Over 4-Year-Old Boy With Car: Cops
content: A government doctor has been arrested here for allegedly running over a four-year-old boy with his car in Gurugram's Surat Nagar Phase 2 on September 15, police said on Saturday.

title: "Likely To Have Humanitarian Consequences": India On Trump Hiking H-1B Visa Fee
content: In a statement, the Ministry of External Affairs said that the H-1B visa fee hike could have a humanitarian consequences by way of disruption caused for families.

title: Old Food, Death Threats: Truck Cleaner 'Kidnapped' By Puja Khedkar's Family
content: The truck cleaner, who was abducted by former IAS probationer Puja Khedkar's family after a road rage accident in Navi Mumbai last week, said he was kept locked in a room, fed stale food and given death threats.

title: "I Don't Have FOMO, Congress Has ROMO": Smriti Irani At NDTV Yuva
content: BJP leader Smriti Irani used the stage at NDTV Yuva's Mumbai edition on Saturday to deliver remarks on politics, democracy, and her party's rivals, while also reflecting on her own political and acting journey.

title: NDTV Yuva Conclave Live: Armaan Malik, The Voice Of The Generation
content: NDTV Yuva returns with its much-anticipated Mumbai edition today, bringing together powerful voices, thought-provoking conversations, and inspiring stories that reflect the spirit and ambition of young India.

title: Nepal-Like Gen Z Protest Possible In India? What KTR Told NDTV
content: A Nepal-like Gen Z protest could happen in India if governments fail the aspirations of the people, Bharat Rashtra Samithi leader KT Rama Rao has warned.

title: China Teen Gains 1.4 Cm From Body Lengthening Therapy, Loses It In 2 Weeks
content: A Chinese teen who participated in a "body lengthening" program for six months grew taller, only to see the gains vanish as soon as the treatment ended.

title: NASA IMAP Mission To Explore The Far Reaches Of The Solar System
content: NASA is gearing up to launch the Interstellar Mapping and Acceleration Probe (IMAP), a mission aimed at exploring the farthest reaches of our solar system.

title: China Extends Social Media Sanctions To Include Weibo, Kuaishou
content: China's internet regulator said it would take "disciplinary and punitive measures" against popular apps Weibo and Kuaishou for highlighting celebrity news and "undesirable" content, extending a crackdown on social media platforms.

title: Zelensky Says Will Meet Trump Next Week As Russia Intensifies Attacks
content: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky said he would meet US counterpart Donald Trump on the sidelines of the United Nations General Assembly next week as Russia intensified strikes across his country.

title: Minimum Wage For Domestic Workers? Karnataka Plans 5% Welfare Cess
content: It was only recently that the Karnataka Labour department brought in a bill to provide social security to gig workers in Karnataka, close on the heels of that, now a bill for social security of domestic workers in its planning stages.

title: Emmanuel Macron Takes Risk With Palestinian Statehood Recognition
content: French President Emmanuel Macron scored a major diplomatic coup by declaring his intention to recognise a Palestinian state.

title: 'Shocked, Devastated': Gaza City Assault Leaves Palestinians Traumatised
content: Gaza City has been the focus of Israel's blistering assault in recent weeks, according to the territory's civil defence agency, a rescue force operating under Hamas authority.

title: US' H-1B Visa Application Fee Hike Will Hit Indian Tech Companies: Industry Body
content: Industry body Nasscom said the US' move to raise H-1B visa application fee to USD 100,000 will impact India's technology services companies as business continuity will be disrupted for onshore projects that may require "adjustments".

title: MRP Of Room ACs Down Up To Rs 4,700, Dishwasher Prices Slashed From Sep 22
content: Leading appliance makers have reduced prices of room air conditioners by up to Rs 4,500 and on dishwashers by up to Rs 8,000, with new rates set to be rolled out from Monday as companies extend GST benefits to consumers.

title: On Camera, Man Travels 175 km To Reconcile With Wife, Then Slits Her Throat
content: He travelled nearly 175 km to amend things with his estranged wife, but ended up slitting her throat in public. This gruesome incident happened in Odisha's Balasore, with the woman's condition critical.

title: RJD's Rohini Acharya's "No Desire For Any Position" Remark Sparks Buzz
content: Amid the build-up to the Bihar Assembly elections, the RJD is facing an internal challenge from within the family of its supremo Lalu Prasad Yadav, as his daughter Rohini Acharya has taken to social media to express her deep displeasure.

title: IIT-Kharagpur Student Found Hanging, 5th Suspected Case Of Suicide This Year
content: The body of a researcher was found hanging inside a hall in IIT-Kharagpur this afternoon. The researcher's body was discovered hanging from the BR Ambedkar Hall around 2 pm.

title: 'Strong Father One Moment, Caring Mother Next': Rekha Gupta On PM Modi
content: Delhi Chief Minister Rekha Gupta said a plan is ready to address all the problems the national capital faces, while also blaming the previous AAP administration for not addressing the many issues the people faced over the past 11 years.

content: People can book an appointment online through a QR code or link and speak to the Subcollector through videoconferencing. Initially, six 15-minute slots have been allocated on Wednesdays and Fridays from 3 p.m. to 4.30 p.m.

title: Finally, justice for forest officials in Mathikettan issue
content: An  order states that the government had withdrawn all charges against the officials and their service and retirement-related benefits will be allotted. title: Lanka Dinakar proposes to develop Veligonda Project as tourist spot
content: The 20-Point Programme Chairman meets Prakasam District Collector P. Raja Babu and discusses the speedy completion of Veligonda project to provide water in the Western part of the district for drinking, irrigation and industrial needs

title: Sanctity of temple is not so fragile as to be endangered by presence of those who live modestly in nearby slum: Karnataka High Court
content: The sanctity of a temple is not so fragile as to be endangered by the presence of the Creator‚Äôs children who, by accident of circumstance, live modestly besides it in a slum, said the High Court of Karnataka

title: ICU sexual assault case: survivor to protest before Health Minister‚Äôs residence
content: Five hospital staff members, suspended and later transferred for allegedly threatening the survivor, were moved back to Kozhikode after approaching the Kerala Administrative Tribunal and recently securing a favourable order

title: MSMEs are the backbone of India‚Äôs economy, says Minister
content: Kondapalli Srinivas highlights MSMEs‚Äô vital role in GDP, exports, and employment, and outlines the State‚Äôs push for growth through ESG integration and rural development initiatives

title: PM's salute to young boy wins hearts, viral video captures priceless reaction - watch
content: the TOI News Desk is your trusted source for staying informed and connected to the ever-evolving global landscape . the team is at the forefront of gathering, verifying, and presenting breaking news, in-depth analysis, and insightful reports on a wide range of topics .

title: 'Our biggest enemy is ...': PM Modi's 'atmanirbhar' push amid Trump tariffs
content: the TOI News Desk comprises a dedicated and tireless team of journalists who operate around the clock to deliver the most current and comprehensive news and updates to the readers of the Times of India worldwide . the team is at the forefront of gathering, verifying, and presenting breaking news, in-depth analysis, and insightful reports on a wide range of topics .

title: Onion procurement by A.P. govt. to be stopped from September 22 as compensation announced for farmers
content: From Monday onwards, farmers have to sell their produce directly to traders or at markets wherever they get a good price, says Kurnool Joint Collector

title: Watch: Jharkhand Rail Blockade | Trains Cancelled, Passengers Stranded
content: According to a statement issued by the railways, train services in the jurisdiction of the South Eastern Railway (SER) and Dhanbad division of the East Central Railway (ECR) have been partially affected due to the agitation by Adivasi Kudmi Samaj

title: Registration begins for e-auction of units in TUDA Towers in Tirupati
content: The e-auction will be held for commercial shops or office spaces on September 26 and 27, while the same for flats will be done from September 29 to October 14

title: Actor¬†Mohanlal to be presented Dadasaheb Phalke Award for 2023
content: The award will be presented at the 71st National Film Awards ceremony on September 23; during his career spanning more than four decades, the Malayalam superstar has worked in 400 films and taken home five National Awards.

content: The elections to 40 constituencies across the Bodoland Territorial Region will be held on September 22

content: The Dholera Special Investment Region is around 100 km south of Ahmedabad and 134 km from State capital Gandhinagar

title: MSC Elsa 3 shipwreck caused significant ecological disruption in south-eastern Arabian Sea, finds study by CMLRE
content: The persistence of oil even after several days, despite prevailing turbulence and current flows, highlighted the risk of continued leakage, it noted

title: ASHA asks government to clear pending bills to protect hospital sector
content: The government has not revised fee structures for various treatment procedures for the last seven years and the number of procedures has gone up to 3200 from 800 in the last few years, explains AP Speciality Hospitals Association

title: Madras High Court rejects mosque‚Äôs claim over 1,100 acres as waqf property
content: Justice M. Dhandapani rules that it is entitled to only 2.34 acres on the basis of a grant given in 1712 by the then ruler of Madurai Samasthanam.

title: Diarrhoea outbreak kills two in Bihar, over 70 fall sick
content: A special medical camp has also been set up at the Sara Mohanpur village, where children reported the symptoms two days ago, but now most residents are affected

title: Meghalaya groups resent exemption of uranium mining from public consultations
content: Meghalaya has one of the country‚Äôs largest uranium reserves in the Domiasiat, Wahkaji, and the adjoining areas of the West Khasi Hills district

title: TVK chief Vijay hits out at T.N. CM Stalin over campaign curbs, foreign investment trips

title: Ashwini Vaishnaw conducts breakthrough of bullet train tunnel; says first phase to start in 2027
content: The first phase of the bullet train project will be first launched on the Surat-Bilimora section in 2027, covering Thane in 2028 and the Bandra Kurla Complex in 2029, Mr. Vaishnaw said

title: CFB Week 4 best bets: Take the points with the Sun Devils at Baylor?
content: college football week 4 brings a board full of numbers that look tempting at first glance . some of these matchups hinge on mismatches in the trenches, others on pace and red zone execution . a few are simply about trusting what we already know .

title: First-month grades for all 20 Premier League teams: From an A+ to F
content: pep Guardiola's side are top of the premier league table . a point won and lost already matter just as much as the points lost in the spring . the result is the fastest player to reach 50 goals in just 49 games .

title: Buccaneers' '76 throwbacks reign supreme in NFL Week 3 threads
content: the originals include a running Jaguar on the teal jersey sleeves and a triple-color stripe on white pants . the helmet has the original primary logo decal worn from 1995 to 2013, with the numbers complementing the look in white with a black and golf .

title: News: Wilyer Abreu nears return; Astros' Alvarez back on IL
content: fantasy baseball buzz file aims to provide fantasy managers with the intel they need as news breaks around MLB . a doubleheader with the red-hot Cleveland Guardians visiting the Minnesota Twins for a separate admission twin bill .

title: Power Rankings: Where every team ranks with less than two weeks left
content: three teams have clinched playoff spots for the second consecutive year . there are nine left to fill with 11 days remaining in the 2025 regular season . it's just a matter of time before additional clubs lock up berths, but others still have a lot to play for .

title: Champions League overreactions: Arsenal only PL team to have deep run
content: arsenal beat athletic club 2-0 in their champions league clash in Bilbao . twenty-six teams won at least three of their eight matches, and 24 advanced . club Brugge lost by scores of 3-0, 3-1 and 3-1 .

title: 2026 class rankings: Coaching carousel hitting top recruits
content: the coaching changes have reopened the recruitments for several players within the SC Next 300 player rankings . the impact on the rankings is likely far from done . a promising UCLA class lost several commits following the dismissal of DeShaun Foster .

title: NLL releases full 2025-26 regular-season schedule
content: the national lacrosse league has revealed its entire 126-game, regular-season schedule for the 2025-26 season . the matchup pits the Toronto Rock against the newly relocated Oshawa FireWolves on Nov. 28 . this game will feature 2025 no. 1 overall pick CJ Kirst of the Rock taking on reigning NLL Rookie of the Year Dyson Williams .

title: Let's preview Week 3 games: Picks, predictions, and nuggets to know
content: quarterback injuries have affected a few top QBs . quarterbacks are ruled out, and quarterbacks' Brock Purdy and the Commanders' Jayden Daniels are listed as questionable . the Chiefs look to dig themselves out of their first 0-2 start against the Giants .

title: The Playbook: Lineup locks, Shadow Reports for Week 3
content: Mike Clay explains why fantasy managers should bench WR Jerry Jeudy in the Browns' week 3 matchup against the Packers . this column features score projections, over/unders, win probabilities, and, of course, easily digestible fantasy advice .

title: WNBA playoff schedule: Semifinals set with Mercury-Lynx, Fever-Aces
content: the WNBA semifinals are a best-of-five with a 2-2-1 setup . the higher seed will host games 1, 2, 5 and 7 . we'll update each series as games are played and each round as matchups are decided .

title: WWE SmackDown takeaways: Contracts for Wrestlepalooza signed
